definition: as if drunk or entranced (idiom); leading a befuddled existence/in a drunken stupor
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream

sentences.english: That magic wine was just a joke she played on me.
sentences.chinese: 其實“醉生夢死”只不過是她跟我開的一個玩笑。

sentences.english: Physical clutter plagues many people in the illusionary chase of possessions.
sentences.chinese: 身體的波動困擾着許多正在爲財富醉生夢死的人們。

sentences.english: The young man is leading an aimless life, drinking all the day.
sentences.chinese: 這位年輕人過着沒有目標的生活，整天醉生夢死。

sentences.english: Don't lament for the past, don't expect too much in future.
sentences.chinese: 不要悲嘆過去，也不要醉生夢死。

definition: to make oneself do sth in spite of adversity, pain etc
the person who shares your bed/partner/spouse
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
to murmur endearments (idiom)/to get into a romantic relationship
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
